words.definition: If something is astronomical, then it is extremely large.
words.example: The cost of the new building was astronomical.

words.definition: An atom is the smallest unit of a substance.
words.example: Water is made of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom.

words.definition: Breadth is the distance from one side to the other side of something.
words.example: The breadth of the river was about fifty meters.

words.definition: A circumference is the distance completely around a circular object.
words.example: The circumference of the wheel was two meters.

words.definition: A comet is an object in space that looks like a bright star with a tail.
words.example: We saw a comet in the sky last night.

words.definition: A crater is a large hole in the ground caused by an explosion or impact.
words.example: The meteor created a large crater in the desert.

words.definition: A crescent is a shape that is curved and pointed at both ends.
words.example: The moon was a thin crescent in the sky.

words.definition: Debris is the pieces that are left after something has been destroyed.
words.example: The street was covered in debris after the storm.

words.definition: Despair is the feeling of having no hope.
words.example: He was in despair after losing his job.

words.definition: To embed something means to fix it firmly in a surrounding mass.
words.example: The thorn was embedded in her finger.

words.definition: A fragment is a small piece that has broken off something larger.
words.example: He found a fragment of glass on the floor.

words.definition: A galaxy is an extremely large group of stars and planets.
words.example: Our solar system is part of the Milky Way galaxy.

words.definition: If something is gigantic, it is extremely large.
words.example: The whale is a gigantic animal.

words.definition: Gloom is a state of near darkness or a feeling of sadness.
words.example: The room was filled with gloom after the lights went out.

words.definition: To radiate means to send out heat or light.
words.example: The sun radiates heat and light to the Earth.

words.definition: To roam means to move around without a particular purpose.
words.example: The cattle roamed freely across the field.

words.definition: If someone is solitary, they spend a lot of time alone.
words.example: He leads a solitary life in a small cabin in the woods.

words.definition: A spectrum is a range of different colors or ideas.
words.example: A rainbow shows the full spectrum of colors.

words.definition: A sphere is an object that is shaped like a ball.
words.example: The Earth is a sphere.

words.definition: Status is the position or rank of someone in a society.
words.example: He has a high status in the company.
